text: ਜਲ ਮਹਿ ਮੀਨ ਮਾਇਆ ਕੇ ਬੇਧੇ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The fish in the water is attached to Maya.

transliteration.text: jal mah mīn māiā kē bēdhē .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. In this Raag, the soul is relaying the happiness that the mind could potentially experience if it joined in with this devotion.

author.author: Guru Arjan Dev
author.description:
Guru Arjan Dev [1563 - 1606] was the fifth Guru of the Sikhs, born at Goindval. He was the youngest of the three sons of Guru Ram Das, the fourth Sikh Guru.

Guru Arjan Dev finished the construction of the Harimandir Sahib, the Golden Temple, and compiled the first Sikh scripture, known as the Adi Granth. Shortly after he became the first martyr of the Sikh religion, which formed a turning point in the development of the faith.

section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The moth fluttering around the lamp is pierced through by Maya.

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. It is a kind of fanaticism, where there is a feeling of not being aware or caring about anything else. The emotions conveyed are those of contentment and of being absorbed in a steadfast belief or faith. translation.text: The sexual desire of Maya afflicts the elephant.

translation.text: The snakes and bumble bees are destroyed through Maya. ||1||

translation.text: Such are the enticements of Maya, O Siblings of Destiny.

translation.text: As many living beings are there are, have been deceived. ||1||Pause||

translation.text: The eighty-four Siddhas, the beings of miraculous spiritual powers, play in Maya. ||2||

text: ਮਾਇਆ ਮਹਿ ਕਾਲੁ ਅਰੁ ਪੰਚ ਦੂਤਾ ॥੩॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Death and the five demons are in Maya. ||3||

text: ਕਹਿ ਕਬੀਰ ਜਿਸੁ ਉਦਰੁ ਤਿਸੁ ਮਾਇਆ ॥
section: Bhairao - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Says Kabeer, whoever has a belly to fill, is under the spell of Maya.

transliteration.text: kah kabīr jis udar tis māiā .

melody.description: Bhairao embodies the soul’s faith and heartfelt devotion towards The Creator. translation.text: The mortal is emancipated only when he meets the Holy Saint. ||5||5||13||
